categorize module¶

This module is used to generate categorize (Level 1) product from pre-processed radar, lidar and MWR files.

categorize.fetch_lidar(lid_vars, fields, time, height)[source]¶

Read and rebin lidar 2d fields in time and height.

Parameters:
  • lid_vars – Pointer to lidar variables
  • fields (tuple) – Tuple of strings containing lidar fields to be averaged.
  • time – A 1-D array.
  • height – A 1-D array.
Returns:

Rebinned lidar fields.
Return type:

(dict)
Raises:

KeyError – Missing field.
categorize.fetch_radar(rad_vars, fields, time_new)[source]¶

Read and rebin radar 2d fields in time.

Parameters:
  • rad_vars – Pointer to radar variables
  • fields (tuple) – Tuple of strings containing radar fields to be averaged.
  • time_new – A 1-D array.
Returns:

Rebinned radar fields.
Return type:

(dict)
Raises:

KeyError – Missing field.
categorize.generate_categorize(input_files, output_file, aux)[source]¶

Generate Cloudnet Level 1 categorize file.

Parameters:
  • input_files (tuple) – Tuple of strings containing full paths of 4 input files (radar, lidar, mwr, model).
  • output_file (str) – Full path of output file.
  • aux (tuple) – Tuple of strings including some metadata of the site (site_name, institute).
categorize.get_altitude_grid(rad_vars)[source]¶

Return altitude grid for Cloudnet products. Altitude grid is defined as the radar measurement grid from the mean sea level.

Parameters:rad_vars – Radar variables.
Returns:Altitude grid
categorize.get_site_altitude(alt_radar, alt_lidar)[source]¶

Return altitude of the measurement site above mean sea level.

Site altitude is the altitude of radar or lidar, which one is lower.

Parameters:
  • alt_radar (float) – Altitude of radar above mean sea level [km]
  • alt_lidar (float) – Altitude of lidar above mean sea level [km]
Returns:

Altitude of the measurement site.
